posts.post_title: SALE PENDING - T205 Ty Cobb PSA Authentic (poor)
posts.post_content:
SALE PENDING Paypal gift (from your balance or you pay the fees), check or money order.   SALE PENDINGPaypal.  I will pay for insured signature confirmation shipping.
UPDATED - I WILL CONSIDER TRADES (I like just about any Ruth, Gehrig, DiMaggio, & Jackie Robinson, and Rookie Cards of Hank Aaron, Mickey Mantle, Willie Mays, Jackie , Clemente, Pete Rose, Nolan Ryan, Mike Schmidt, Reggie Jackson, George Brett, & Michael Jordan)

[IMG]http://i1291.photobucket.com/albums/b558/wv25801wv/t205_zps8ab84646.jpg[/IMG]
[IMG]http://i1291.photobucket.com/albums/b558/wv25801wv/t2052_zps8ac72cff.jpg[/IMG]
Am I missing the "Altered" part? Any idea what they are saying is wrong with it? Looks like a clean "1" from what I can see.
I do not know.  I usually assume some slight trimming.  However, I am not expert.  I do not see any added ink/color.

It's due to the heavy tear/crease in the center of the card. Only makes the card grade an A.  An 1 or A in this case makes no difference in price. The back is a bit tougher than most Cobb backs other than Pied 42's and AB's.

[quote name="T205 GB" post=1231445]It's due to the heavy tear/crease in the center of the card. Only makes the card grade an A.  An 1 or A in this case makes no difference in price. The back is a bit tougher than most Cobb backs other than Pied 42's and AB's.[/QUOTE]

If it was just the tear I would think it would just say AUTHENTIC, yet this has a designation of ALTERED added to it. I haven't seen that added to cards that are just too low of a grade to be a 1.  There has to be something else, or a mistake by PSA.  Based off the condition, though, I am sure whatever the "alteration" was, it wasn't done to deceive.

[quote name="bn2cardz" post=1231474]If it was just the tear I would think it would just say AUTHENTIC, yet this has a designation of ALTERED added to it. I haven't seen that added to cards that are just too low of a grade to be a 1.  There has to be something else, or a mistake by PSA.  Based off the condition, though, I am sure whatever the "alteration" was, it wasn't done to deceive.[/QUOTE]

It could have been glued back together in that crease?
With all this talk I'm surprised this card hasn't been sold yet.  First $350 gets it!

I'm now considering partial or full trades.

Thank you
